description: Let f(n) be the smallest number such that the arithmetic mean (A) and geometric mean (G) of n and f(n) are both integers; sequence gives A values.
comments: It is the average of A038387 with n, both of which are multiplicative. - _Christian G. Bower_, May 16 2005Multiplicative with a(p^e) = a(p^(2k+1)) = (p + p^(2k+1))/2, a(2^(2*k)) = 2 + 2^(2k-1), a(p^(2*k)) = (1 + p^(2k))/2. - _Christian G. Bower_, May 16 2005
references: Mohammad K. Azarian, AM - GM Strikes Again, Problem 451, College Mathematics Journal, Vol. 22, No. 3, May 1991, p. 255.  Solution published in Vol. 23, No. 3, May 1992, pp. 248-249.
Mohammad K. Azarian, An Application of the Inequality on the Means, Problem B-635, Fibonacci Quarterly, Vol. 27, No. 1, Feb. 1989, p.87.  Solution published in Vol. 28, No. 1, Feb. 1990, pp. 86-87.
mathematica: Table[k = 1; While[Nand @@ IntegerQ /@ {a = (n + k)/2, Sqrt[n*k]}, k++]; a, {n, 78}] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jul 14 2013 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
